title: Large-Scale Intensive Short-Term Course on Identifying Scientific Trend Relationships Using Visual Imagery

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (sets, relations) and matrices/graphs, along with foundational proficiency in scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation-experimentation-analysis)
context.additional_context: For general citizens with advanced domain expertise in science (e.g., ecology, physics, chemistry), conducted in a BYOD environment, focusing on experimental data analysis and evidence-based conclusion drawing.

learning_goals: Learners can visualize scientific data as graphs and identify trend relationships (e.g., causal, correlational) with ≥85% accuracy.
Learners can explain the mutual conversion process between matrix and graph representations without errors using scientific experimental data (e.g., temperature-pressure measurements).
Learners achieve ≥80% problem-solving rates by applying trend relationships to real-life scientific problems (e.g., ecological food chains, chemical reaction pathways).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
